input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: I’m here because the little boy’s right testicle wasn’t in the usual spot when he was born. His other side looks fine, but that one has always seemed smaller and hasn’t moved down properly. We’re really just worried about it being okay and wanna make sure everything’s all right.
output:
THINKING: The patient reports that the boy has a right testicle that was not in the usual position at birth, with the right testicle appearing smaller and not having moved down properly, but no mention of pain or other symptoms. No additional clinical details are provided in the latest conversation that contradict or add to the previous vignette.  
ANSWER: The boy has a right undescended testicle that was not in the usual position at birth, and the right testicle appears smaller and has not descended properly.

output:
